description: [Status: stable] [Name: percent-format-mixed-positional-and-named] [Message: %-format string has mixed positional and named placeholders] What it does Checks for printf-style format strings that have mixed positional and named placeholders. Why is this bad? Python does not support mixing positional and named placeholders in printf-style format strings. The use of mixed placeholders will raise a TypeError at runtime. Example "%s, %(name)s" % ("Hello", {"name": "World"}) Use instead: "%s, %s" % ("Hello", "World") Or: "%(greeting)s, %(name)s" % {"greeting": "Hello", "name": "World"}
